title: How to Make Wood Floor Polish (Beeswax and Essential Oils)

steps.headline: Add the beeswax to the bowl.
steps.description: Using a double boiler bowl is fine if you have one.

steps.headline: Put the bowl in a pan of boiling water.
steps.description: Melt the beeswax. When the beeswax is melted, remove it from the water.

steps.headline: Once off the heat, stir until the beeswax starts to cool.
steps.description: Add the turpentine and stir through until it is well mixed in. If using, add the extract or essential oil drops when the polish is soft and cool.

steps.headline: Transfer the mix to a suitable storage container with a lid.
steps.description: Label and date. It will last 4-5 months in cool area.

steps.headline: Use the wood floor polish as follows:
